title: Colva - one of the most popular beach destinations in Goa
text:
Travel Articles | August 10, 2015 
Colva is a popular tourist destination of Goa. It is one of the most visited beach towns located on the south of the state. The place is most known for the majestic 2 k.m. long beach which is perfect for relaxing and sunbathing. 

Colva is a small hamlet, basically a beach town overlooking the Arabian Sea and is one of the most popular tourists spots in Goa. It is located on the south of the state, about 8 k.m. from the city of Margao and most known for the white sandy beach that is of 2 k.m. in length. Being a popular tourist destination there are a large number of hotels, resorts, restaurants, shacks, pubs, and bars filling up the place. It is the former retreat of the high society families during the colonial era and today is marked with multiple ruins in the forms of old bungalows, villas, and other structure. The place is also home to the church of Igreja de Nossa Senhora das Merces, which is a highly revered church in the state and remains flocked with pilgrims. 
Margao is the nearest urban city and houses the nearest major bus stop as well as railway station. From Margao one can easily get taxis and buses travelling to the beach town. Scooters are also available on rental basis offered by many of the tour companies. They are a good medium to access Colva; particularly if one is a bit adventurous getting into the town on a scooter is an experience to relish. There are about 8 railway stations in Goa, and the major railway stations are located in Vasco, Madgaon, Pernem, and Canacona. The good thing is that Colva is well-connected to all major railway stations of Goa. The nearest airport is located in Dabolim. It is one of the best International Airports of the country and about 29 k.m. away. One can easily get a taxi to Colva from the outside of the terminal. Besides, most of the luxury hotels in Colva also offer airport pick and drop services. 
The Colva town sits adjacent to the western coast of India. It is a small hamlet, basically a fishing village. The perfect sun-kissed beach is the prime attraction here. It often remains filled with tourists as well as locals. The beach is lined with a long string of shacks, restaurants, and hotels. Some of the hotels situated here ranks amongst the best hotels in Goa and are equipped with all modern amenities and facilities. Plus, they also offer some recreational services like spa and exotic massage. 
The foodies will find Colva a heaven as the exquisite restaurants serve a large menu of appetizing cuisine ranging from culinary seafood to international dishes. Feni is a popular local alcohol of Goa and is a must-try if one wants to get a feel of the state. Additionally, there are some other things to indulge into. Spending a lazy day at the beach is the most popular activity here. The turquoise sea water along with the white sandy beach with colorful shacks and long palm fringes filling it together form a spectacular sight. One will often see tourist picking up the sea shells and basking the sun. There also exist a couple of water sports clubs offering a couple of routines that the tourist can indulge into. 
Colva is also known for the large number of hotels that fill the surroundings. There are all sorts of hotels belonging to different budget category. The budget hotels in Colva are highly popular amongst the tourists as they are known to offer a satisfactory stay at reasonable price.
